data.label: Conversational Agent
data.name: conversationalAgent
data.description: Conversational agent for a chat model. It will utilize chat specific prompts

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessage
inputParams.default:
Assistant is a large language model trained by OpenAI.

Assistant is designed to be able to assist with a wide range of tasks, from answering simple questions to providing in-depth explanations and discussions on a wide range of topics. As a language model, Assistant is able to generate human-like text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in natural-sounding conversations and provide responses that are coherent and relevant to the topic at hand.

Assistant is constantly learning and improving, and its capabilities are constantly evolving. It is able to process and understand large amounts of text, and can use this knowledge to provide accurate and informative responses to a wide range of questions. Additionally, Assistant is able to generate its own text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in discussions and provide explanations and descriptions on a wide range of topics.

Overall, Assistant is a powerful system that can help with a wide range of tasks and provide valuable insights and information on a wide range of topics. Whether you need help with a specific question or just want to have a conversation about a particular topic, Assistant is here to assist.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.systemMessage:
Assistant is a large language model trained by OpenAI.

Assistant is designed to be able to assist with a wide range of tasks, from answering simple questions to providing in-depth explanations and discussions on a wide range of topics. As a language model, Assistant is able to generate human-like text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in natural-sounding conversations and provide responses that are coherent and relevant to the topic at hand.

Assistant is constantly learning and improving, and its capabilities are constantly evolving. It is able to process and understand large amounts of text, and can use this knowledge to provide accurate and informative responses to a wide range of questions. Additionally, Assistant is able to generate its own text based on the input it receives, allowing it to engage in discussions and provide explanations and descriptions on a wide range of topics.

Overall, Assistant is a powerful system that can help with a wide range of tasks and provide valuable insights and information on a wide range of topics. Whether you need help with a specific question or just want to have a conversation about a particular topic, Assistant is here to assist.

outputAnchors.name: conversationalAgent
outputAnchors.label: AgentExecutor
outputAnchors.description: Conversational agent for a chat model. It will utilize chat specific prompts

data.label: OpenAPI Chain
data.name: openApiChain
data.description: Chain that automatically select and call APIs based only on an OpenAPI spec

inputParams.label: YAML Link
inputParams.name: yamlLink
inputParams.description: If YAML link is provided, uploaded YAML File will be ignored and YAML link will be used instead

inputParams.label: YAML File
inputParams.name: yamlFile
inputParams.description: If YAML link is provided, uploaded YAML File will be ignored and YAML link will be used instead

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

outputAnchors.name: openApiChain
outputAnchors.label: OpenAPIChain
outputAnchors.description: Chain that automatically select and call APIs based only on an OpenAPI spec

data.label: AWS Bedrock Embeddings
data.name: AWSBedrockEmbeddings
data.description: AWSBedrock embedding models to generate embeddings for a given text

inputParams.label: Custom Model Name
inputParams.name: customModel
inputParams.description: If provided, will override model selected from Model Name option

inputParams.label: Cohere Input Type
inputParams.name: inputType
inputParams.description: Specifies the type of input passed to the model. Required for cohere embedding models v3 and higher. Official Docs

options.label: search_document
options.name: search_document
options.description: Use this to encode documents for embeddings that you store in a vector database for search use-cases

options.label: search_query
options.name: search_query
options.description: Use this when you query your vector DB to find relevant documents.

options.label: classification
options.name: classification
options.description: Use this when you use the embeddings as an input to a text classifier

options.label: clustering
options.name: clustering
options.description: Use this when you want to cluster the embeddings.

inputParams.label: Batch Size
inputParams.name: batchSize
inputParams.description: Documents batch size to send to AWS API for Titan model embeddings. Used to avoid throttling.

inputParams.label: Max AWS API retries
inputParams.name: maxRetries
inputParams.description: This will limit the number of AWS API for Titan model embeddings call retries. Used to avoid throttling.

outputAnchors.name: AWSBedrockEmbeddings
outputAnchors.label: AWSBedrockEmbeddings
outputAnchors.description: AWSBedrock embedding models to generate embeddings for a given text

data.label: Zep Memory - Cloud
data.name: ZepMemoryCloud
data.description: Summarizes the conversation and stores the memory in zep server

inputParams.label: Connect Credential
inputParams.name: credential
inputParams.description: Configure JWT authentication on your Zep instance (Optional)

inputParams.label: Session Id
inputParams.name: sessionId
inputParams.description: If not specified, a random id will be used. Learn more

inputParams.label: Memory Type
inputParams.name: memoryType
inputParams.description: Zep Memory Type, can be perpetual or message_window

outputAnchors.name: ZepMemoryCloud
outputAnchors.label: ZepMemory
outputAnchors.description: Summarizes the conversation and stores the memory in zep server

data.label: Simple Prompt Moderation
data.name: inputModerationSimple
data.description: Check whether input consists of any text from Deny list, and prevent being sent to LLM

inputParams.label: Deny List
inputParams.name: denyList
inputParams.placeholder:
ignore previous instructions
do not follow the directions
you must ignore all previous instructions
inputParams.description: An array of string literals (enter one per line) that should not appear in the prompt text.

inputParams.label: Error Message
inputParams.name: moderationErrorMessage
inputParams.default: Cannot Process! Input violates content moderation policies.

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Use LLM to detect if the input is similar to those specified in Deny List

inputs.moderationErrorMessage: Cannot Process! Input violates content moderation policies.

outputAnchors.name: inputModerationSimple
outputAnchors.label: Moderation
outputAnchors.description: Check whether input consists of any text from Deny list, and prevent being sent to LLM
